fields.description:
*Assessment*

After upgrading from Eucalyptus 3.4.2 to Eucalyptus 4.0.0, the objectstorage.providerclient isn't set to 'walrus', therefore the objectstorage service remains in a 'LOADED' state.  To make things easier after the upgrade, objectstorage.providerclient should be populated with 'walrus' when the Walrus service is ENABLED.

*Sighs*

* Objectstorage service in LOADED state after registering UFS:
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca_conf --register-service -T user-api -N Throwback -H 10.104.10.11
Created new partition 'Throwback'
SERVICE	user-api          	Throwback 	Throwback            	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/User-API	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:user-api:Throwback/
SERVICE	loadbalancing     	Throwback 	Throwback.loadbalancing	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/LoadBalancing	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:loadbalancing:Throwback.loadbalancing/
SERVICE	euare             	Throwback 	Throwback.euare      	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/Euare	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:euare:Throwback.euare/
SERVICE	cloudwatch        	Throwback 	Throwback.cloudwatch 	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/CloudWatch	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:cloudwatch:Throwback.cloudwatch/
SERVICE	compute           	Throwback 	Throwback.compute    	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/compute	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:compute:Throwback.compute/
SERVICE	tokens            	Throwback 	Throwback.tokens     	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/Tokens	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:tokens:Throwback.tokens/
SERVICE	autoscaling       	Throwback 	Throwback.autoscaling	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/AutoScaling	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:autoscaling:Throwback.autoscaling/
SERVICE	objectstorage     	Throwback 	Throwback.objectstorage	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/objectstorage	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:objectstorage:Throwback.objectstorage/
ERROR	imaging           	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	ImagingServicePropertyBootstrapper.enable( ): returned false, terminating bootstrap for component: imaging
ERROR	imaging           	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	ColocationBootstrapper.enable( ): failed because of: The imaging service depends upon a locally ENABLED eucalyptus, terminating bootstrap for component: imaging
ERROR	imaging           	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	ERR-1015 2014-05-18 15:30:22 Imaging worker image not configured.  Imaging service will not be available.

[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-describe-services
SERVICE	user-api          	Throwback 	Throwback            	ENABLED 	25  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/User-API	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:user-api:Throwback/
SERVICE	autoscaling       	Throwback 	Throwback.autoscaling	ENABLED 	25  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/AutoScaling	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:autoscaling:Throwback.autoscaling/
SERVICE	cloudwatch        	Throwback 	Throwback.cloudwatch 	ENABLED 	25  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/CloudWatch	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:cloudwatch:Throwback.cloudwatch/
SERVICE	compute           	Throwback 	Throwback.compute    	ENABLED 	25  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/compute	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:compute:Throwback.compute/
SERVICE	euare             	Throwback 	Throwback.euare      	ENABLED 	25  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/Euare	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:euare:Throwback.euare/
SERVICE	loadbalancing     	Throwback 	Throwback.loadbalancing	ENABLED 	25  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/LoadBalancing	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:loadbalancing:Throwback.loadbalancing/
SERVICE	objectstorage     	Throwback 	Throwback.objectstorage	LOADED  	25  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/objectstorage	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:objectstorage:Throwback.objectstorage/

SERVICE	cluster           	UndergroundLuxury	HeadBand             	ENABLED 	25  	http://10.104.1.194:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:UndergroundLuxury:cluster:HeadBand/
SERVICE	reporting         	bootstrap 	10.104.10.55         	ENABLED 	25  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/Reporting	arn:euca:bootstrap::reporting:10.104.10.55/
SERVICE	bootstrap         	bootstrap 	10.104.10.55         	ENABLED 	25  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::10.104.10.55/
SERVICE	jetty             	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	ENABLED 	25  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/Jetty	arn:euca:eucalyptus::jetty:10.104.10.55/
SERVICE	loadbalancingbackend	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	ENABLED 	25  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/LoadBalancingBackend	arn:euca:eucalyptus::loadbalancingbackend:10.104.10.55/
SERVICE	imaging           	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	NOTREADY	25  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/Imaging	arn:euca:eucalyptus::imaging:10.104.10.55/
SERVICE	notifications     	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	ENABLED 	25  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/Notifications	arn:euca:eucalyptus::notifications:10.104.10.55/
SERVICE	eucalyptus        	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	ENABLED 	25  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::10.104.10.55/
SERVICE	cloudwatchbackend 	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	ENABLED 	25  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/CloudWatchBackend	arn:euca:eucalyptus::cloudwatchbackend:10.104.10.55/
SERVICE	autoscalingbackend	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	ENABLED 	25  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/AutoScalingBackend	arn:euca:eucalyptus::autoscalingbackend:10.104.10.55/
SERVICE	dns               	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	ENABLED 	25  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/Dns	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:10.104.10.55/
SERVICE	walrusbackend     	walrus    	PaperRoute           	ENABLED 	25  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/WalrusBackend	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrusbackend:PaperRoute/

[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-describe-properties objectstorage.providerclient
PROPERTY	objectstorage.providerclient	{}
{code}

*Workaround*

After registering the UFS, set the cloud property 'objectstorage.providerclient' to 'walrus'.

*Steps*

* Set up Eucalyptus 3.4.2 
* Upgrade to Eucalyptus 4.0
* Make sure euca.p12 files are synced across Eucalyptus Java components:
{code}
$ euca_conf --sync-euca-p12
{code}
* Register User Facing Services:
{code}
$ euca_conf --register-service -T user-api -N Throwback -H 10.104.10.11
{code}
* Observe cloud property objectstorage.providerclient and ObjectStorage service
fields.summary: Upgrading to Eucalyptus 4.0, objectstorage.providerclient should be set to 'walrus'
fields.environment:
*non-HA, single cluster
** 1 x CLC
** 1 x UFS, Walrus
** 1 x CC, SC (overlay)
** 1 x NC

comments.body: To be documented, for 4.0. [~tvo], please link the doc ticket, then un-assign the ticket.
This step is called out in the upgrade doc for 4.0.

[~tony], [~hspencer], and [~viglesias]:
Because of the way this property is implemented, as a static property rather than an explicit db entity, there is no clear or easy way to set the value in an upgrade case that does not also set the value to a default for new installs. I can fix this behavior, but it would require db schema changes and would therefore only be viable in 4.1.0. We have three choices for 4.0.1:
# Leave it as it is and put a better fix in 4.1.0 that allows the admin to set the value before registering any OSGs, but would still require a 'modify-property' to set.
# Set 'walrus' as the default for both upgrades and new installs (basically the default value for the property initializes to 'walrus').
## This would require using modify-property to set the value to anything other than 'walrus' and restarting any OSGs already registered and started in order to pickup the new value at bootstrap.
## Subsequent upgrades etc would not be affected because the value is already initialized
## 3.4.x -> 4.0.1 Upgrade sequence: run upgrade and you're done
## 4.0.1 clean install:
### Install bits, init and start CLC
### set property to 'riakcs' if you don't want walrus.
### Register OSGs (and Walrus if you do want it)

The first option does not preclude the 2nd, so I could do both: set default for 4.0.1 and a bigger fix in 4.1.0.

My recommendation is option 2 because it gives you a reasonable cloud out-of-the-box and you can explicitly set the riakcs backend before you register any OSGs. I'm running through some tests to ensure that it behaves as I have initially seen WRT restart and config behavior to use RiakCS.
Links related DOC ticket: DOC-1416 for updating the install/upgrade guides for slightly new procedure.

[~zhill], I was just verifying this and objectstorage.providerclient property is still not set to walrus on upgrade. I checked out the linked doc ticket. Between that and what I get from the comments in this issue, the property should be set default to walrus when register ufs is done correct?  Wanted to run by you before I rejected the fix.

Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.1
Release     : 0.0.22237.28.20140715git864f36a.el6

[~tony], do you have a system that has been upgraded but not otherwise touched? I'd like to see what is in the DB.
I was able to reproduce the issue. [~zhill] will take it back.

Tweaked the initialization a bit.

[~tony], I tested this doing a source upgrade from 3.4.3 -> 4.0.1 (a bit tricky), and it worked fine. I will be out of town starting Tuesday, so any further issues on this ticket should be directed to [~swathi].

Fix Verified

After upgrading to 4.0.1 objectstorage.providerclient is set to walrus by default.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.1
Release     : 0.0.22243.33.20140720gitdaefdaa.el6

Too quick to move to verified. The property itself was, in fact, set on upgrade. However, the objectstorage service could not start after upgrade.  The cloud-output.log shows an error that the property is not set, yet euca-describe-properties shows it set as walrus.

[~tony], [~viglesias], [~tjcramer], [~swathi]: I'm recommending removing these fixes from 4.0.1 and addressing it more thoroughly in 4.1.0. The issue is the type of property used, and changing it would require a database change and thus, make it infeasible for 4.0.1.

I think the one additional configuration step, setting walrus, is preferable to possible instability resulting from further changes here. I think there may be additional bugs in how the static properties are initialized that we're hitting.

TL;DR; (since I'm heading out on vacation for a bit):
The configurable property is a static variable in the class. It initializes to "walrus" per the annotation but the value itself is null. It could be set to start as "walrus" as well (this is the normal way of doing things), but that causes another problem: when the OSG bootstraps on non-CLC hosts it initializes before the properties are initialized and propagated, so if this variable is set to "walrus" statically it will configure the OSG as walrus-backed even if the DB value of the property is "riakcs". That means the OSG would be running Walrus but be configured to use RiakCS--not good. In the normal bootstap sequence the OSG always finds an empty string (the original init value) when it bootstraps and then waits and retries to find the proper value once the properties have been properly set from the CLC. The proper solution here is to make this provider client value part of the ObjectStorageGlobalConfiguration entity so that the OSG can manage it directly without these additional lifecycle complications. But, that would have to be a 4.1.0 change.

Reverted both the commits as per the note above. 

[~tony], can you please verify that upgrade plus the additional configuration step (set the objectstorage.providerclient property to "walrus") results in a working setup? If so, it brings us back to where we started and I'll change the fix version to 4.1.0.

Issue has been fixed in 4.1.0 release. Upgrade from 3.x to 4.1.0 will default objectstorage.providerclient to 'walrus'. Upgrade from 4.0.x to 4.1.0 will preserve the value configured for objectstorage.providerclient

Fix Verified.

There is no 3.4.X -> 4.1 upgrade path. However, I have verified that 4.0.2->4.1 upgrades preserve objectstorage.providerclient value that was previously set.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.1.0
Release     : 0.0.22972.325.20150112git82fd3a2.el6
